document_data.name: Galleon
document_data.mainbody: A '''galleon''' was an advanced sailing vessel, the largest used by [[Cormyr]], [[Impiltur]], and [[Sembia]] as of the [[1359 DR|Year of the Serpent, 1359 DR]]. Even in these relatively wealthy countries, the galleon was not a common sight on the [[Inner Sea]].
document_data.Description:
Typically {{SI|130|ft|long=yes}} along the keel and {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} across the beam, galleons had three full masts and three decks that could hold a maximum of 800 crew and passengers. With multiple sails and complex rigging, it took a minimum crew of 80 to operate proficiently. The galleon had castles at fore and stern that were usually armed with a total of three large weapons (ballistae or catapults, for example).

Galleons were quite seaworthy,{{Cite dragon/116/High Seas|13}}
document_data.Spelljamming:
[[File:Galleon.png|thumb|250px|''A diagram of the parts of a galleon.'']]
Among "groundling" [[human]]s, a galleon was the vessel most likely to be converted into a [[spelljammer]], a spacefaring vessel, by mounting a [[spelljamming helm]] on the craft. One such craft from the time of the [[Netheril|Netherese Empire]] was preserved after that nation's fall in the desert of [[Anauroch]] within the ruins of [[Hlaungadath]]. As late as [[1358 DR]], the [[lamia]] living in the ruins could not figure out how to operate the ship and make it fly again.
